intro: Rodriguezia delcastilloi, commonly known as the Castillo's rodriguezia, is a rare and striking plant native to the humid forests of Colombia. It is a member of the Anacardiaceae family, which includes cashew and mango, and is characterized by its large, palmate leaves. The plant produces vibrant orange-red flowers that bloom in clusters, attracting various pollinators. It thrives in shaded, moist environments and is often found in the understory of tropical rainforests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
